item.title: Post-Install Miscellaneous Steps
item.description:
Install gnome tweaks

sudo apt install gnome-tweaks

Tweaking the GUI

  1. Open “Extensions” and turn off desktop icons

Update firefox settings

  1. flatpak firefox settings found in ~/.var

item.title: Gnome Remote Desktop
item.description:
sudo apt install vino sudo apt install winpr-utils

sudo systemctl restart gnome-remote-desktop.service
sudo grdctl --system rdp enable

sudo rm -rf ~gnome-remote-desktop/rdp-tls*
sudo -u gnome-remote-desktop winpr-makecert -silent -rdp -path ~gnome-remote-desktop rdp-tls

sudo grdctl --system rdp set-tls-key /var/lib/gnome-remote-desktop/rdp-tls.key
sudo grdctl --system rdp set-tls-cert /var/lib/gnome-remote-desktop/rdp-tls.crt

sudo systemctl daemon-reload
sudo systemctl enable --now gnome-remote-desktop.service
sudo grdctl --system rdp set-credentials "name" "password"

sudo systemctl restart gnome-remote-desktop.service
sudo systemctl status gnome-remote-desktop.service

sudo ufw allow 3389
sudo ufw reload

item.title: Multiple Clocks in Ubuntu / Gnome
item.description:
sudo apt install -y gnome-clocks

flatpak install -y com.mattjakeman.ExtensionManager

flatpak run com.mattjakeman.ExtensionManager

click browse tab search for “world clock” and select “panel world clock”
